ipl::CIntImage Class Reference

CIntImage is an abstract base class derived from CGenericImage consisting of pixels with type INT16, last updated 7/21/2002. More...

#include <ipl98/cpp/int_image.h>

Detailed Description

CIntImage is an abstract base class derived from CGenericImage consisting of pixels with type INT16, last updated 7/21/2002.

Saving and loading images of this type has not yet been fully tested and documentation for the file format still need to be written. Though it should be possible to save and load and all bug reports are welcome!

This class is part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

See also:
CGenericImage
Version:
1.52, by edr@mip.sdu.dk
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ipl::CIntImage::CIntImage (  UINT32    Width,
UINT32    Height,
UINT32    Color = 0
) 
 

Constructor for empty image, allocates memory.

All pixel values are initialised to 0. ROI is inactivated.

Parameters:
Width  The width of image in pixels.
Height  The height of image in pixels.
Color  Initial color value in all pixels. Defaults to 0. The function is faster when Color initializes to 0.

bool ipl::CIntImage::Add (  CIntImage &    Addend ) 
 

Add calculates the sum of two CIntImages.

The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
Addend  is the image of class CIntImage to be added
Returns :
False if one or both of the images involved are empty

bool ipl::CIntImage::Copy (  COMPLEXCHOISE    mode,
CComplexImage &    Source
) 
 

Copies partially an image of class CComplex into this object.

ROI is inactivated. Note that this is a straight forward convertion, values are truncated directly to the destination range. For more advanced convertions look at the methods available in the class CLocalOperation. History from Source is copied to this image, old history in this image is deleted.

Parameters:
mode  Determines what part of the complex image is to be copied. The values are COMPLEX_REAL, COMPLEX_IMAGINARY, or COMPLEX_MODULUS.
Source  is the source image.
Returns :
False if the source image is empty.

bool ipl::CIntImage::CopyDisplace (  int    dx,
int    dy
) 
 

performs a displacement so that (dx,dy) in the old picture becomes (0,0).

Periodic continuation is assumed. The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
dx  is the horizontal displacement
dy  is the vertical displacement
Returns :
False if this image is empty

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), TIntImage::FileInfo, GetConstTIntImagePtr(), CPoint2D< T >::GetX(), CPoint2D< T >::GetY(), m_History, m_Image, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIActive, TFileInfo::PathAndFileName, TString::pChars, and ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine().

bool ipl::CIntImage::CopySubImage (  CIntImage &    SourceImage,
int    xmin,
int    ymin,
int    xmax,
int    ymax
) 
 

Copies sourceImage of type CIntImage to this image.

The values (xmin, ymin, xmax and ymax) specifies the rectangle to be copied, uses integers because of origo offset. ROI is inactivated. If you want the resulting image placed in this image just use the same object for SourceImage. Note: In that case the method is a bit slower (needs to copy a temporary image to the destination). Adds new line to history.

Parameters:
xmin  defines left side of rectangle in source image to copy from
ymin  defines top side of rectangle in source image to copy from
xmax  defines right side of rectangle in source image to copy from
ymax  defines buttom side of rectangle in source image to copy from
Returns :
false if outside image

Definition at line 358 of file int_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), TIntImage::FileInfo, GetConstTIntImagePtr(), m_History, m_Image, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIActive, TFileInfo::PathAndFileName, TString::pChars, and ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine().

bool ipl::CIntImage::CutOrZeroPad (  CIntImage &    Dest ) 
 

Copies a source image into 'this' object without scaling.

If the width/height of the source is larger than that of 'this' object, zero padding is applied. Simple cuts are applied for reduced width/height. The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
Source  is the source image
Returns :
False if this image and/or the source image are empty

const TIntImage * ipl::CIntImage::GetConstTIntImagePtr (    )  const
 

To use the kernel C functions it is sometimes necessary to pass the TIntImage structure.

In other cases do not use this function to manipulate the image but use the methods in this class!

TIntImage * ipl::CIntImage::GetTIntImagePtr (    ) 
 

To use the kernel C functions it is sometimes necessary to pass the TIntImage structure which contents will be changed.

In other cases do not use this function to manipulate the image but use the methods in this class!

Returns :
pointer to a TIntImage structure.

bool ipl::CIntImage::Load (  const char *    pPathAndFileName )  [virtual]
 

Loads file of type given by extension from disk.

Adds new line to history. ROI is inactivated.

Parameters:
pPathAndFileName  Name of file including extension and relative or absolute path, f.ex. absolut path "c:/temp/doggie.bmp", relative "doggie.bmp". Both slash ("/") and back slash ("\") can be used in the path. There is no differense between upper and lower case characters, they are treated equally.
Returns :
false if load failed

Implements ipl::CGenericImage.

Definition at line 679 of file int_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), GetTIntImagePtr(), m_History, TString::pChars, and ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine().

CIntImage & ipl::CIntImage::operator= (  const CIntImage &    SourceImage ) 
 

Overloading of assignment operator.

All information is copied to the destination image including border pixels, ROI, and history. Previous data in this object are destroyed. Origin is set to RAM. File information is left empty. Adds new line to history. An error is produced if both sides of the assignment operator is the same object.

Definition at line 54 of file int_image.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), GetConstTIntImagePtr(), ipl::CText::GetItem(), GetOrigin(), TIntImage::History, m_History, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIActive, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROILowerRight, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIUpperLeft, TString::pChars, ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine(), ipl::CText::SetTextPtr(), and ipl::CText::TotalItems().

bool ipl::CIntImage::SetROI (  const CPoint2D< INT32 > &    UL,
const CPoint2D< INT32 > &    LR
)  [inline, virtual]
 

Sets Region Of Interest (ROI) for this object.

If outside image dimensions false is returned and an error is produced. In that case the state of ROI is left unchanged. Image dimensions are the values returned from the methods GetMinX(), GetMaxX(), GetMinY() and GetMaxY(), i.e. it includes origo offset.

Parameters:
UL  Upper left value of ROI, relative to origo.
LR  Lower right value of ROI, relative to origo.
Returns :
False, if values are outside image dimensions, relative to origo.

Implements ipl::CGenericImage.

Definition at line 796 of file int_image.h.

References GetMaxX(), GetMaxY(), GetMinX(), GetMinY(), CPoint2D< T >::GetX(), CPoint2D< T >::GetY(), TIntImage::Height, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIActive, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROILowerRight, ipl::CGenericImage::m_ROIUpperLeft, TIntImage::Origo, TIntImage::Width, T2DInt::x, and T2DInt::y.

Calculates the difference of two CIntImages.

The border (if present) is not affected. Adds to the history.

Parameters:
